A Message from Superintendent, Dr. Scott Smith:

This is not the ending any of us could have imagined for the end of this school year. Yet, we made it! I commend our students, parents, teachers and staff for being adaptive as we navigated (and continue to navigate) COVID-19. Being adaptive and resilient in a time of change is a quality that will help us all throughout the course of life.

As the class of 2020 embarks on their next chapter of life, join us this evening at 6pm for a town parade! (We are planning a graduation ceremony this summer but wanted to recognize seniors on the official last day). This will be a fun way for us all to wrap up the school year!

Summer school plans are underway for July, but also tentative. We are going to continue to work hard to offer our students the best education possible. Stay tuned for more information.

In the meantime, stay healthy and keep learning Bearcats! I’m proud of you! Let’s have a great summer! If at any time you have any questions or concerns, please let me know.

Sincerely,

Scott Smith

As this information becomes available and we are able to make informed decisions, we will be sharing them with you as soon as possible. This communication will continue through our social media outlets, district website, and parent emails.
Thank you for your patience and understanding as we work through this situation.

(Public Notice of Filing)
January 21, 2020

The Gasconade County R-1 School District will accept declarations of candidacy for any person interested in running for a position on the School Board in the April 7, 2020 election. There are three positions open, with each position being for a three-year term. Persons interested may file at the Office of the Superintendent, located in the Central Office Administration Building at 170 Blue Pride Drive, Hermann, MO 65041.
Although filing is normally closed on days inclement weather has forced cancellations of classes, the Office of the Superintendent is open for business today, January 21, 2020, and will accept filing applications until 5:00 p.m.

This afternoon, as buses were getting ready to depart from Hermann Elementary, the administration was notified of a Facebook post that indicated an elementary student had a weapon at school. Therefore, law enforcement was contacted and students were held on the school bus while administration checked all backpacks. Nothing was found. We do not believe this was a viable threat. Whereas this information has already been communicated with parents by phone and email, we wanted to share this information with the community as well.

Student safety is always a priority. We have safety plans in place for such incidences as today. If parents or students hear of a threat, immediately contact the school or local law enforcement.

We will continue to investigate this claim and work with the Hermann Police Department throughout the investigation. Thank you for your support.
